Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery large chalice with top of cul; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; added white and red bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of seated lion (part of hindquarters, right hind paw, tail, body with two red blobs on side and top of right foreleg remaining) to right; rosettes as filling ornament; below, two dilute bands.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 258, no. 483)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0503) (phase 2)
